taxonomicnotes: Syncrossus berdmorei Blyth, 1860 was described from Tenasserim provinces, Myanmar.
rationale: Syncrossus berdmorei is in great demand for its ornamental value and there are no known records of aquarium breeding and degradation of habitats is ongoing, the species is subjected to great stress and is inferred to be declining in the wild.  These factors may lead to the decimation of the species from its known range of distribution, even though it is known to be widely distributed.  Hence it is assessed as Near Threatened with emphasis on research on biology, threats, impacts of harvest, population trends to reassess the status once all these data become available.
evaluator: Rema Devi, K.R., Arunachalam, M., Dahanukar, N. & Daniel, B.A.
